snippet.textDisplay: This was such a fun game. So many of the tracks were good. I enjoyed the dual play-through with Mint and Rue, although I by far preferred Mint's arc. She was such a character.
snippet.textOriginal: This was such a fun game. So many of the tracks were good. I enjoyed the dual play-through with Mint and Rue, although I by far preferred Mint's arc. She was such a character.

snippet.textDisplay: He didn't really do a whole lot. There's something he composed for in 2018, and some other indie things.

snippet.authorDisplayName: Dr. Schwarzer's Rean Bean Crit Machine

snippet.textDisplay: The gameplay was simple with genuinely gripping characters and OST. It wasn't aiming to be the hardest or longest game. Instead it was focused on telling you a story and that's something I appreciated about the series. Great game and OST.
snippet.textOriginal: The gameplay was simple with genuinely gripping characters and OST. It wasn't aiming to be the hardest or longest game. Instead it was focused on telling you a story and that's something I appreciated about the series. Great game and OST.

snippet.textDisplay: As I think about Threads of Fate all I could think about was how we could have a nice Hack and Slash game for PS1 without frustrating 3D Graphics (Seriously all hack and slash games I saw for PS1 had headache causing graphics and laggy animations) plus it has a nice story too.
snippet.textOriginal: As I think about Threads of Fate all I could think about was how we could have a nice Hack and Slash game for PS1 without frustrating 3D Graphics (Seriously all hack and slash games I saw for PS1 had headache causing graphics and laggy animations) plus it has a nice story too.

snippet.textDisplay: I played this game as I child all the time and I absolutely loved Rue, for his story and his ability to transform. Though I wasn't used to playing as her much, I did enjoy Mint's story as well because of the humor and difference in personality she brought to the table.
snippet.textOriginal: I played this game as I child all the time and I absolutely loved Rue, for his story and his ability to transform. Though I wasn't used to playing as her much, I did enjoy Mint's story as well because of the humor and difference in personality she brought to the table.

snippet.textDisplay: I finished this game yesterday, it was pretty short but really fun and refreshing. This is the track that plays in the final tower. It aged pretty well and the music is still top notch. I definitely prefered playing as Mint over Rue, she was much more interesting.
snippet.textOriginal: I finished this game yesterday, it was pretty short but really fun and refreshing. This is the track that plays in the final tower. It aged pretty well and the music is still top notch. I definitely prefered playing as Mint over Rue, she was much more interesting.

snippet.textDisplay: Mint's story was better for sure.
